intro: Diotostephus, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces long, twisting pods that contain several seeds. Diotostephus thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in shrublands and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
